image.altText: a man and woman smile at the camera with their arm around each other whilst holding rowing ores and kayak paddles in other hand

props.synopsis: After four months of dust storms and chilblains, Anja Wever and Cy Wever-Jetis say giving up was never an option.

title.children: Mother-son duo first to travel entire 2,500km of Murray River

image.altText: chad Cornes announce retirements

props.synopsis: The club has told the 45-year-old assistant coach he won't be returning for the 2026 AFL season.

title.children: Former Premiership player Chad Cornes let go by Port Adelaide

image.altText: A couple pose in front of a brick home featuring solar panels on its roof in daylight

props.synopsis: SA Power Networks has begun collecting an "export tariff" from energy retailers at the same time as many solar customers saw a reduction in their feed-in tariffs. But it remains to be seen how, or if, the new export charge will be passed on to consumers.

title.children: Falling feed-ins and new export tariff frustrate solar customers

image.altText: A large sign of Little Shining Star in a carpark and on top of a building

props.synopsis: An Adelaide early learning centre is under investigation for inappropriately taking and storing images of children's injuries and nappy rash, but police say there is no evidence to support criminal charges.

title.children: Early learning centre being investigated over storage of children's images

image.altText: South Australia Livestock Exchange 2025-06-03 09:06:00

props.synopsis: Australia's sheep flock continues to decrease due to drought, with ewe numbers expected to drop 9 per cent over the next year.

title.children: Australia's sheep flock shrinks with at least two years until recovery

image.altText: Willie Rioli walks off the ground

props.synopsis: Willie Rioli speaks candidly about a tumultuous couple of months he endured this season, admitting he spoke to his manager on multiple occasions about retiring from the AFL.

title.children: Rioli considered retiring as racism and off-field drama became 'a bit too much'

image.altText: A large build up on cloud like foam on a beach.

props.synopsis: South Australian commercial fishers can apply to have licence and other government fees waived if their catches have been impacted by the state's toxic algal bloom, which has now spread to the Port River.

title.children: Fishing sector to have fees waived amid algal bloom, which has now spread to Port River

image.altText: A yellow excavator is helping demolish the Willyama High School.

props.synopsis: Willyama High School in outback New South Wales is knocked down, after a hygienist's report finds its mould problem is so extreme the building is not worth fixing.

title.children: Demolition of mould-infested high school begins 18 months after closure

image.altText: A worked scoops up heavy snow at Thredbo resoirt

props.synopsis: Parts of the country have recorded their coldest June mornings in decades, but on average, winters are getting warmer.

title.children: Colder than Antarctica, as June brings winter chill to eastern states

image.altText: A smiling woman hugs an older man lying in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: A retired farmer, who has lived in the country his whole life, has been told to move to Adelaide to continue receiving life-saving dialysis, as there are no options available closer to home.

title.children: Patient faces choice of moving to city or giving up life-saving treatment

image.altText: A close-up of a woman with a serious expression

props.synopsis: More than 500 current and former supermarket workers across regional South Australia will receive $5.5 million in back pay, after securing what their union describes as "one of the biggest retail underpayment settlements" in the state's history.

title.children: More than 500 supermarket workers to share in $5.5m after court settlement

image.altText: CCTV frame shows Erin Patterson standing by the Leongatha Hospital entrance speaking to a nurse, both wear masks.

props.synopsis: A doctor who first alerted police to now convicted triple-murderer Erin Patterson describes the moment he grew suspicious of her.

title.children: Erin Patterson labelled 'evil' by doctor who came face-to-face with killer

image.altText: Michele Bullock gestures standing behind a microphone, with RBA logo behind her

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank shocked most experts, and borrowers, by keeping interest rates on hold in July, but does it mean we might see a super-sized cut in August?

title.children: Why we'll know if RBA will cut rates in August in three weeks' time

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks and holds his hands open while Pete Hegseth, seated next to him, watches.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump flags a possible 200 per cent tariff on pharmaceuticals — one of Australia's biggest exports to the US — and says copper could be hit with a 50 per cent levy.

title.children: Trump flags tariffs of 200pc on pharmaceuticals, 50pc on copper

image.altText: Michael Balderstone prepares a cannabis joint.

props.synopsis: AHPRA says poor prescribing practices and surging consumer demand are leading to "significant" patient harm, and releases new guidelines urging prescribers to put patient wellbeing above profits.

title.children: Action taken against over 50 practitioners in medicinal cannabis crackdown

image.altText: A woman sits in a wheel chair in a well-lit room surrounded by art supplies.

props.synopsis: Carol Taylor's mammogram was cancelled because she uses a wheelchair. When she eventually got a scan, she was diagnosed with breast cancer.

title.children: Carol was denied a mammogram. Now she's having treatment for breast cancer

image.altText: A white alpaca standing in a field.

props.synopsis: An unlikely hero has emerged in the fight against an "absolutely terrifying" virus which has again reared its head in Australia.

title.children: Why a cute Chilean alpaca named Pedro could hold the key to stopping a deadly virus

image.altText: Training documents containing text, bullet points, and redacted sections, displayed against a blue backdrop.

props.synopsis: The ABC asked for details of concerns raised about children being detained in adult prisons — and got more in return than it expected.

title.children: The ABC was sent a document twice: redacted and unredacted. Here's what we found

image.altText: Marco Rubio wearing a suit and tie at a Senate hearing, with a neutral expression.

props.synopsis: A US diplomatic cable says the impersonator attempted to contact three foreign ministers and two US politicians, with the goal of attempting to access information or accounts.

title.children: AI scammer posing as Marco Rubio targets foreign ministers, US politicians

image.altText: A soccer player in a yellow and green jersey sits on the ground and raises her arms in triumph.

props.synopsis: Joe Montemurro admits his side has a mountain of work to do despite managing to escape with a stoppage time win over Panama courtesy of a late Charlie Grant winner.

title.children: Matildas coach laments 'technical errors' in last-gasp win over Panama

image.altText: An Aboriginal man with a white moustache and beard, white hair, red vest over black shirt with a sombre expression.

props.synopsis: Kumanjayi Walker's family members have welcomed the Northern Territory coroner's findings after six years of waiting for answers. As they mourn the death of another loved one, they say the fight for justice isn't over.

title.children: 'We felt racism killed Kumanjayi': Yuendumu responds to coronial finding

image.altText: People carrying a coffin with a cloth with a star of David

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says the five soldiers "fell during combat in the northern Gaza Strip".

title.children: Five Israeli soldiers killed as Gaza ceasefire talks continue

image.altText: Four people searching debris on the banks of a river. Debris is littered throughout tree branches.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump describes the catastrophic Texas floods as a one-in-100-year event — a disaster "nobody expected". But a political debate is raging over whether cuts to the public service have played a role.

title.children: Were the Texas floods a disaster 'nobody expected' — or an avoidable catastrophe?

image.altText: The mugshots of three young men, side-by-side.

props.synopsis: The three men set ablaze a warehouse unit in London that stored aid and satellite equipment to be sent to Ukraine.

title.children: Trio guilty of UK arson attack linked to Russian mercenary group Wagner

image.altText: two man with baseball caps and lanyards, one in yellow shirt, other in black and blue take selfie in front of a 3 tiered pagoda

props.synopsis: Foreign tourists are trickling back to China after the country loosened its visa policy to unprecedented levels.

title.children: China extends visa-free entry to a record 74 countries

image.altText: Hannah sitting in the sun smiling with a drink in hand.

props.synopsis: The body of Hannah Maguire, 23, was found last year in a torched car and her ex-partner charged with the killing. He is today expected to plead not guilty before a jury.

title.children: Trial set to start for Ballarat woman's accused murderer

image.altText: A young woman with blonde hair and brown eyes smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: In New South Wales, just 7 per cent of sexual assault cases reported to police resulted in a conviction. Lily's story offers an insight into how the system treats victim-survivors.

title.children: Lily's friends shunned her after she was raped. She went to court anyway, and won

image.altText: A man sitting on a couch with a baby and his son

props.synopsis: Not having family support, having children with disabilities, and inflexible working arrangements make the school holiday juggle difficult for these working parents.

title.children: 'The messy middle': How our readers balance annual leave and school holidays

image.altText: A man and a woman stand near a 3D printed model of an aorta in a lab

props.synopsis: The Queensland man's aorta, the biggest blood vessel in the body, had ballooned to about four times the usual size, leaving it in danger of rupturing.

title.children: Surgeons and engineers work together to save Queensland man's life

image.altText: An Orange exterior shopfront wall with paint damage

props.synopsis: With a 1,000 employees and about 4,400 clients affected, aged care, disability and veterans care service provider Annecto goes into voluntary administration, leaving staff fearful for their entitlements and their clients.

title.children: Carers, clients 'devastated' as major care provider collapses

image.altText: Woman with pink mohawk and black short sleeved shirt

props.synopsis: A new virtual hub and reduced medication costs are expected to make an "enormous difference" to women suffering from menopause and perimenopause symptoms.

title.children: Lucy suffered for a decade with a condition 'neglected for many years'

image.altText: The exterior of a restaurant with smashed glass doors and a sign that says Miznon at night time.

props.synopsis: Three people have been charged with assault, riotous behaviour and criminal damage after a group of protesters converged on an Israeli-owned restaurant in Melbourne's CBD on Friday night.

title.children: Three protesters charged over incident at Israeli restaurant in Melbourne

image.altText: A middle-aged man in an akubra and a dark suit walks along a city street.

props.synopsis: ABC journalist Gavin Coote has told a court that he "vividly" remembers speaking to one of the men who has accused MP Gareth Ward of indecent assault.

title.children: ABC reporter tells of meeting with MP's alleged indecent assault victim

image.altText: Woman getting breast cancer screening done

props.synopsis: Eligibility for some cancer screening programs has recently been expanded to reflect the increasing cancer rates among younger Australians, while other programs have just rolled out this month. Here's what to know.

title.children: What your eligibility is for Australia's free cancer screening programs

image.altText: Profile shot of man with grey hair, a brunette woman facing him and holding his face in both her hands

props.synopsis: Made as a way to cope with grief over losing his wife, legendary filmmaker David Cronenberg's latest movie looks at what happens when technology intrudes on the very human matter of death.

title.children: Legendary 81yo filmmaker processes his grief through haunting tech horror
